programme.desc: The mayor is electrocuted while speaking at the Kembleford village fete, and Father Brown suspects he was the victim of a deliberate act. Meanwhile, Mrs McCarthy's past comes back to haunt her. Mystery, starring Mark Williams and Sorcha Cusack.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest's priceless Blue Cross is targeted by infamous criminal Flambeau, so taking matters into his own hands Father Brown sets out to try to save the thief's soul, but risks falling into a trap. Mystery, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Crime drama about a British detective working on a Caribbean island. When the owner of a sugar plantation is discovered dead with a machete in his back, DI Poole and his team have a seemingly impossible case to solve. There are numerous suspects, including the victim's alcoholic ex-wife and much younger widow, but they all have seemingly cast-iron alibis - and many were with one another when the murder took place. Crime drama, starring Ben Miller, with guest appearances by Stephanie Beacham (Dynasty, Tenko), James Cosmo (Game of Thrones) and Tom Ward (Silent Witness).

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A young nun is found dead in a smoke-filled bedroom in what seems like a terrible accident caused by a lit cigarette. But when Richard deduces it must have been murder, there are no shortage of suspects, including other nuns, a priest and the mother superior - as well as an unscrupulous PR man promoting a holy spring in the convent grounds. The question is, with the room locked from the inside, how could anyone have committed the crime in the first place? Kenneth Cranham, Patrick Baladi and Caroline Langrishe guest star.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: Murdoch reunites with inventor Nikola Tesla to help with the murder investigation of a man experimenting on a devise that would make him invisible.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A body is discovered floating in the pool of an exclusive cosmetic surgery clinic and several things point to suicide - the victim was going through a messy divorce and there is an empty pill box in her room. But DI Poole has several reasons to believe Valerie Dupree was murdered - not least the fact she poured herself a cup of the world's most expensive tea but only drank half. The pressure is on to find the culprit as the clinic is highly respected on the island and the chief surgeon is an old friend of Commissioner Patterson - and as the detectives begin to dig, they discover many sordid secrets among the guests and staff. Cherie Lunghi (Secret Diary of a Call Girl), James Fleet (The Vicar of Dibley) and Emma Pierson (Hotel Babylon) guest star.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Treasure hunters arrive on the island to track down the loot of a legendary pirate, a search that comes to an abrupt halt when the party's geologist is shot dead in leader Daniel Morgan's tent. As the murder weapon was a 300-year-old pistol, DI Poole decides every member of the team is a suspect - but the investigation takes a strange turn when Daniel falls victim to a series of unfortunate and coincidental accidents. Has a mythical pirate's curse become a reality or is someone from the 21st century simply trying to bump him off? Ben Miller and Sara Martins star, with Michael Brandon (Dempsey and Makepeace) and Kelly Adams (Hustle).

programme.title: Lady Chatterley
programme.desc: Sir Clifford employs a nurse to look after him, leaving his wife with more time to devote to her clandestine relationship with Mellors. However, the passion of the affair is beginning to wane. Starring Joely Richardson and Sean Bean.

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: Lynda La Plante's crime drama. DI Pat North investigates the case of a woman abducted in broad daylight, but a sudden murder confession leaves the squad with more questions than answers. Meanwhile, DCS Michael Walker begins to fear for his children's safety at the hands of his ex-wife's new boyfriend. Kate Buffery and David Hayman star.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Part two of two. The roguish antiques dealer finds a Scottish gothic temple brings him closer to Lady Jane, while love is in the air for Eric. Ian McShane stars.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: DI Morell investigates Honey's apparent abduction by new husband Scott, little suspecting she has fled with him of her own volition and is preparing to set sail for France. Unfortunately, he blurts out a confession of his guilt as they're waiting for the boat to arrive, leaving her facing the uncomfortable realisation that she's trapped with a murderer. Back at Sun Hill, Yvonne leaves herself open to charges of using excessive force to detain a suspect and Amber teases Dan Casper about his alleged run-in with a gang of armed youths.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Honey is interviewed by Adam and fights to save her career, insisting she was abducted by new husband Scott. JT begins to suspect Gina has cancer, and Dan alleges Amber has been blackmailing him to do menial duties on her behalf, while Yvonne is devastated to learn Lee Thomas, the young thug she forcibly restrained at the cemetery, has died of his injuries.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of three. Yvonne is suspended from duty pending further investigation into the death of young thug Lee Thomas, and Leela is also accused of assaulting a suspect, leaving the relief uncertain as to what constitutes reasonable force when making an arrest. Fearful of leaving himself open to accusations of heavy-handedness or police brutality, Tony later hesitates to use force in a confrontation with local youths - and suffers a horrific beating. Meanwhile Zain Nadir agrees to do a stint in CID before beginning his next undercover job.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of three. As Tony recovers in hospital, Gabriel and Roger are disciplined for using their CS spray in a tense situation, prompting June to stand up for coppers' rights and call the demoralised relief out on strike. Unfortunately for Lance, he's already been dragged out on an unauthorised mission by Zain Nadir, and ends up being held at gunpoint by a local gangster. On the personal front, Phil receives the shocking news that Kate Maltby has been rushed to hospital and might lose their baby, while Dan receives a letter in the internal mail from someone who clearly knows about his affair with Sun Hill newcomer Rochelle Barratt.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A young nun is found dead in a smoke-filled bedroom in what seems like a terrible accident caused by a lit cigarette. But when Richard deduces it must have been murder, there are no shortage of suspects, including other nuns, a priest and the mother superior - as well as an unscrupulous PR man promoting a holy spring in the convent grounds. The question is, with the room locked from the inside, how could anyone have committed the crime in the first place? Kenneth Cranham, Patrick Baladi and Caroline Langrishe guest star.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A body is discovered floating in the pool of an exclusive cosmetic surgery clinic and several things point to suicide - the victim was going through a messy divorce and there is an empty pill box in her room. But DI Poole has several reasons to believe Valerie Dupree was murdered - not least the fact she poured herself a cup of the world's most expensive tea but only drank half. The pressure is on to find the culprit as the clinic is highly respected on the island and the chief surgeon is an old friend of Commissioner Patterson - and as the detectives begin to dig, they discover many sordid secrets among the guests and staff. Cherie Lunghi (Secret Diary of a Call Girl), James Fleet (The Vicar of Dibley) and Emma Pierson (Hotel Babylon) guest star.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Treasure hunters arrive on the island to track down the loot of a legendary pirate, a search that comes to an abrupt halt when the party's geologist is shot dead in leader Daniel Morgan's tent. As the murder weapon was a 300-year-old pistol, DI Poole decides every member of the team is a suspect - but the investigation takes a strange turn when Daniel falls victim to a series of unfortunate and coincidental accidents. Has a mythical pirate's curse become a reality or is someone from the 21st century simply trying to bump him off? Ben Miller and Sara Martins star, with Michael Brandon (Dempsey and Makepeace) and Kelly Adams (Hustle).

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Dr Turner and Shelagh are at the forefront of the advances in medical technology, and begin a campaign to ensure better respiratory health for their patients. However, Timothy fears their own lifestyle is not good for them and tries to encourage his parents to give up smoking. Violet injures her back and is forced to leave the shop in Fred's hands, a decision that strengthens their relationship but which proves to have other, unforeseen consequences. A new mother's past comes to light, with devastating repercussions for her family. Nurse Crane draws on her own experiences to help her.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Poplar is rocked by a series of violent attacks on women, and a prostitute is too ashamed to report what she knows - but her actions lead to a dangerous man roaming the streets, with devastating consequences for the residents of Nonnatus House. A mother tries to keep her daughter's pregnancy a secret to avoid gossip, putting her life in danger. The Turners go on a long overdue holiday, but the weather ruins their plans.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The introduction of the contraceptive pill is welcomed by Dr Turner, but some of his colleagues are less keen on the idea. Patsy tries to help a bargee who wants to give birth among her own community rather than in a maternity ward. Nurse Crane deals with an emergency during a storm, and a familiar face returns to Nonnatus House - but has been changed by her time away.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Dr Turner is horrified to realise he may be partly to blame as the cause of the recent rise in birth deformities comes to light, and tries to prevent further cases. Sister Evangelina returns to work, but has clearly been affected badly by her stroke, and her health continues to deteriorate. A pregnant bride goes into labour during her wedding reception, while her mother is forced to come to terms with her grandchild being conceived out of wedlock.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Christmas special of the period drama, which catches up with the nurses and midwives of Nonnatus House in 1962. They receive a letter from a doctor running a mission clinic on the Eastern Cape of South Africa, who is in desperate need of their help to save her urgently needed hospital from closure. The nurses head to Africa to lend a hand, finding the clinic understaffed, underfunded and with a poor water supply, but overwhelmed with patients who need their help more than anyone ever has before. Sinead Cusack guest stars.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Kristin, Breen and Gina witness a fatal skydiving accident while celebrating Mike's birthday with a picnic. To make matters worse, Kristin knows the victim - entrepreneur Andre Barrington, an ex-boyfriend. When the cords are found severed, it becomes clear that his demise was either suicide or murder.

programme.title: Lady Chatterley
programme.desc: Connie's marriage begins to fall apart, so she flees to her father's seaside retreat. But before she leaves, she must fulfil her promise to Mellors of one last night together. Starring Joely Richardson and Sean Bean.

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: As a third victim is found murdered, Marilyn soon identifies the man responsible as Damon Morton (Iain Glen), and Walker must gather evidence to secure his conviction.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the Headland Garden in Polruan, Cornwall - one of the participants opening its havens to the public in the National Gardens Scheme - where plants face the harsh conditions of salt air and high winds.

programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Australian Wilderness with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The adventurer follows the Frankland River into the heart of the 65 million-year-old Walpole Forest - 200 square kilometres of wooded wilderness in Western Australia that provides food and shelter for Aboriginal people. Ray learns that the river was once used by loggers to transport jarrah wood, which is so hard it was used as cobbles for London streets in Victorian times. In the forest, the adventurer lies in wait for the elusive quokka, a small and shy marsupial, and meets environmentalist Prue Anderson, who shows him some of the other forest creatures that she's captured on her hidden camera.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: The GMB team is joined by Lorraine Kelly for the final hour, with the latest on the coronavirus pandemic, as well as other stories.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Gemma Atkinson and Gorka Marquez talk about becoming parents with Christine Lampard, Saira Khan, Janet Street-Porter, and Gloria Hunniford.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James goes on a culinary journey around the UK, with fellow chef and friend Galton Blackiston joining him as he begins in the Isles of Scilly. The pair don diving suits to swim with seals and hire an unusual mode of transport to take them around the islands.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A team of family members answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Malone quietly seethes when the police discover his 4x4 smoldering in a field, Chas railroads Belle into attending Take a Vow's lingerie party, and Mandy encourages Bob to tell Wendy how he really feels.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Geoff despairs as Yasmeen walks out on him, Bernie implores Chesney to keep a close eye on Gemma, and Michael attends a job interview at Underworld. David heads out for a walk, but when Gail quizzes him, he refuses to tell her where he's going.

programme.title: Coronavirus: Q&A
programme.desc: Nina Hossein puts viewers' questions on a range of subjects relating to the Covid-19 outbreak to a panel of expert guests.

programme.title: St Davids - Britain's Smallest City
programme.desc: Forager Julia scours the shoreline for seaweed for her sustainable soaps, the bug farm hosts its summer fair and the residents of Britain's smallest city celebrate the end of the busy summer season at farmer Gerald's harvest party.

programme.title: Liar
programme.desc: Now reunited with Katy, Laura takes drastic measures to hold the person framing her to account in a last-ditch bid for her freedom. But first, she must discover his identity and where he's hiding. To achieve what she needs to prove her innocence, she is forced to collude with the most surprising of people and the shocking truth of what happened on the morning Andrew died is finally revealed. Conclusion of Harry and Jack Williams' thriller, starring Joanne Froggatt and Ioan Gruffudd.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Keane & Vieira - Best of Enemies
programme.desc: The on-field rivalry between midfielders Roy Keane and Patrick Vieira during their time at Manchester United and Arsenal respectively, when they strived for dominance in a golden period for the clubs. There was no love lost between the two combative players, who captained their teams and enjoyed many memorable battles in the quest for Premier League glory. In this programme, Gabriel Clarke interviews both men.

programme.title: All Elite Wrestling: Dynamite
programme.desc: Action from the latest edition of the weekly AEW event, featuring all of the biggest stars on the roster, including Adam Page, Chris Jericho, Cody and Jon Moxley.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: 1000 Heartbeats
programme.desc: Vernon Kay hosts the quiz show in which contestants' pulses are monitored and they must complete seven rounds before their hearts beat 1,000 times to win 25,000 - meaning they will have to stay calm under pressure or risk losing the jackpot.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James is joined by chef Galton Blackiston for a tour of Cornwall. They sample some world-class ice cream before visiting Newlyn fish market to buy cod, which James cooks with oysters and tartare sauce. The trip concludes with a visit to Sennen beach, where they practice their oil painting and break out the barbecue.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five members of a Surrey bowling club answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates a comical selection of mishaps filmed by viewers, featuring everything from giddy grandmas, cute kids and crazy animals to below-the-belt mishaps, practical jokers and painful-looking accidents.

programme.title: Best Walks with a View with Julia Bradbury
programme.sub-title: Britain's Best Walks with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: The presenter embarks on her favourite countryside walk through the rolling plains of Cheshire, a trail with eight counties on show, two castles to explore and spectacular views across to Wales and Liverpool. A popular route for dog-walkers and sports, her trek proves to be full of surprises.

programme.title: Tales from the Coast with Robson Green
programme.desc: The actor meets people who share his passion for the British coast, beginning with north Devon, a 90-mile stretch of shoreline that holds fond childhood memories for him. Robson starts his adventures by visiting the popular seaside resort of Ilfracombe, a town that stills attracts thousands of visitors every summer, to experience the classic British day out by the sea. After spending a night under canvas, he takes a boat ride to the port of Clovelly, a village that evokes the character and atmosphere of a bygone age, and visits the island of Lundy.

programme.title: Return to Belsen
programme.desc: Jonathan Dimbleby returns to the site of the Bergen-Belsen concentration camp on the 75th anniversary of the liberation of the survivors by British troops. Jonathan's father was with the Allied forces as a reporter, and his account was one of the first to bring the full horrors of the Holocaust to the world's attention. Featuring contributions from survivors, liberators, and their children.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Gordon, Gino and Fred: American Road Trip
programme.desc: Having previously toured their own countries, Gordon Ramsay, Gino D'Acampo and Fred Sirieix now hit the highways of of the States - although in the first episode, they are in Mexico, on a mission to taste the world's best breakfast. Along the way, the trio take part in a chili-eating competition, have a beach buggy race and watch some traditional Mexican wrestling - but it isn't long before they are persuaded not take part.

programme.title: Kate & Koji
programme.desc: Despite Kate being sued after an accident in the cafe, she refuses to back down and Koji is reluctant to get involved. Although Medium is convinced she should just apologise and get it over with, Kate suspects the legal threats may have something to do with Councillor Bone. Comedy, starring Brenda Blethyn and Jimmy Akingbola.

programme.title: Belgravia
programme.desc: John appeals to members of the Trenchards' staff in his bid to uncover the truth about Charles, while Turton and Ellis are quick to betray their employers and prove surprisingly adept at deceit and spying. Susan makes a seemingly miraculous discovery, and begrudgingly agrees to accompany Anne and James to their country estate in the hope of extracting further information about Oliver. Stephen makes a last-ditch attempt to secure the funds he needs to pay off his debt - a deal that puts his life in danger.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Barging Round Britain with John Sergeant
programme.desc: The broadcaster returns to travel more of Britain's canal network, exploring the extraordinary stories of the people and places on the way. The series starts with John navigating the Peak Forest Canal, which runs through stunning countryside from Buxworth in Derbyshire to Ashton-under-Lyne. Along the way, in Hyde he meets former boxer Ricky Hatton, who discusses his plans to revitalise the area and offer new opportunities to local youngsters, and joins a team of junior archaeologists at Mellor Mill, who are attempting to unearth the remains of what was once one of the world's largest mills.

programme.desc: On the next leg of his Islands to Highlands tour, James travels to Devon where he meets his friend and Michelin-starred chef Simon Hulstone. While they are in the area, James visits a mushroom farm, and Simon samples some award-winning cheese, which inspires James to prepare an extravagant cheese platter.

programme.title: Tenable

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Jamie explains to Paddy that the only way to solve his money problems is to fire Belle, Al and Priya share a passionate kiss and Malone puts Billy in a difficult position.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Gemma boards the bus with the quads, but is suddenly overcome by a wave of anxiety and hurries off the bus, leaving her babies behind. The return of Rick's daughter Kelly rattles Gary, and Yasmeen consults the police about Geoff's past.

programme.title: Kate & Koji
programme.desc: When word reaches that a storm is headed for town, Kate refuses to step in line, much to the grief of Councillor Bone. Koji discovers he has been given a jacket with an unfortunate history, and Medium may have lost Kate a lot of money on the horses. Comedy, starring Brenda Blethyn and Jimmy Akingbola.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: The comedian follows the work of Battersea Dogs & Cats Home in London, meeting staff involved in treating, training and rehoming animals. This time, Paul meets a 10-month-old puppy who has been brought into Battersea twice for being too boisterous, before helping to soothe a pointer cross who has had a hard life.

programme.title: The Trouble with Maggie Cole
programme.desc: As the drama concludes, Roxanna is terrified by Alex's behaviour the previous night, and tries desperately to get to Alex before he confronts the money lenders. Meanwhile, Jill is still feeling shaken after witnessing Peter and Karen kissing and wonders if she should tell Maggie what has happened. As everyone gathers for the village celebrations, a sudden shocking series of events are put in motion that could potentially cost the life of one beloved villager. Starring Dawn French, Mark Heap and Gwyneth Keyworth.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.desc: Political magazine show presented by Robert Peston, featuring major interviews with MPs, topical guests and cultural figures. Including updates from social media taking in perspectives from viewers, experts and key players throughout the programme.

programme.title: Broadchurch
programme.desc: The third and final series of Chris Chibnall's crime drama set in a Dorset seaside town edges toward its conclusion in the penultimate episode, with important pieces of evidence coming to light against all the key suspects in the rape of Trish Winterman. Ellie and Hardy can feel the vice tightening on the culprit and know that the case will crack open soon. Starring David Tennant and Olivia Colman, with Julie Hesmondhalgh, Charlie Higson, Jodie Whittaker and Lenny Henry.

programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: The GMB team is joined by Lorraine Kelly for the final hour, with the latest on the coronavirus pandemic, as well as other stories.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Andrea McLean, Kelle Bryan, Carol McGiffin and Kaye Adams are on the Loose Women panel, discussing the day's most topical issues, from current affairs to celebrity gossip and the latest showbiz news. The women discuss the invasive nature of modern technology and whether or not they believe phones and laptops are used to spy on their owners.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James is joined by friend and Michelin-starred chef Mark Jordan, riding around Jersey on mini motorbikes while exploring the island's culinary delights. James samples one of Jersey's most famous exports - the Jersey Royal potato - which he uses to cook up a squid risotto with a difference. Mark gets a lesson in oyster shucking and James uses Jersey black butter to create a black butter tartlet.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz, hosted by Warwick Davis, in which a family of five from Cambridgeshire answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as another four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser. Answering general knowledge questions, they each add as much money as they dare to the jackpot - but anyone caught by the Chaser is out for good, leaving fewer players to team up and play in the final chase.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates a comical selection of mishaps filmed by viewers. Highlights include a diver slapped by a stingray and a man who hits himself with an axe.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs show that tackles the issues behind the headlines from a Scottish perspective.

programme.title: Griff's Great Australian Adventure
programme.sub-title: Spirit of Queensland: Brisbane to Cairns
programme.desc: Comedian, actor and travel enthusiast Griff Rhys Jones journeys from Brisbane to Cairns aboard the Spirit of Queensland railway - and during his various stops, he comes across all manner of things that seem determined to kill him, from jellyfish to dingoes to whitewater rapids and more.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: Coronavirus: How Safe Are Our Jobs? Tonight
programme.desc: Just a couple of months ago the economy was riding high with employment at record levels. But that was before the coronavirus epidemic tightened its grip on Britain, ripping up the way of life. In the past 14 days half a million people have signed on for Universal Credit. With the Government projected to spend many tens of billions in a bid to keep the economy, and jobs, afloat, Sonali Shah investigates: how safe are British jobs?.

programme.title: Gordon, Gino and Fred: American Road Trip
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay aims to show his companions that US food lives up to its reputation of being bigger and better as they travel from Nevada to Los Angeles. They begin in style with a helicopter ride about the Grand Canyon - although Gino is too nervous to appreciate the spectacle below him. Next up is a trout fishing trip contest in the Colorado River, followed by a burger in Las Vegas with a hefty price tag of $777 and a visit to a ranch where they have to round up herds of cattle on horseback. Finally, they hit Los Angeles, where they have a barbecue battle.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Return to Belsen
programme.desc: Jonathan Dimbleby returns to the site of the Bergen-Belsen concentration camp on the 75th anniversary of the liberation of the survivors by British troops. Jonathan's father was with the Allied forces as a reporter, and his account was one of the first to bring the full horrors of the Holocaust to the world's attention. Featuring contributions from survivors, liberators, and their children.

programme.title: The Olivier Awards
programme.desc: Jason Manford presents the best moments from the past few moments of the theatrical awards, with a line-up of star-studded cast of award-winners and presenters taking to the stage to celebrate the best in live theatre. Including performances by the casts of The Lion King, Mamma Mia!, The Book of Mormon, Hamilton, Dreamgirls, Come from Away and Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat.

programme.title: Liar
programme.desc: Now reunited with Katy, Laura takes drastic measures to hold the person framing her to account in a last-ditch bid for her freedom. But first, she must discover his identity and where he's hiding. To achieve what she needs to prove her innocence, she is forced to collude with the most surprising of people and the shocking truth of what happened on the morning Andrew died is finally revealed. Conclusion of Harry and Jack Williams' thriller, starring Joanne Froggatt and Ioan Gruffudd.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The investigation into the murder of 29-year-old Niall is made difficult by those closest to him, who seem intent on obscuring the facts, and it is not until the body of a drug dealer washes up on a beach that the dreadful truth begins to emerge. While coping with revelations of her own, Vera sifts through evidence of the grief, love and addiction that characterised Niall's life as she tries to find out why someone wanted him dead. With Judy Parfitt (Call the Midwife) and Phyllis Logan (Downton Abbey).

programme.title: The Theory of Everything (2014)
programme.desc: Biopic of Stephen Hawking, exploring the renowned astrophysicist's romance with future wife Jane during their time at university in the 1960s and his initial diagnosis with motor neurone disease, which doctors believed would lead to his death within two years. Undaunted by deteriorating health, he continued his groundbreaking research into the origins of the universe. Starring an Oscar-winning Eddie Redmayne, with Felicity Jones and David Thewlis.

programme.desc: George takes the Spuds to the museum of mouldy cheese. Anna dares Dave to lick the cheeses on display, and Dave's bad breath wakes one of the exhibits up.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Gran accidentally wins a board game as a Bingo prize, and after being locked up for years the game has a vendetta all of its own..

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James presents a special Easter edition of the cookery show, joined by Matthew Kelly and chefs Nathan Outlaw and Paul Foster. Also dropping in is Bake Off: Creme De La Creme winner Mark Tilling, who demonstrates how to make some chocolate treats.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James goes on a culinary journey around the UK, with fellow chef and friend Galton Blackiston joining him as he begins in the Isles of Scilly. The pair don diving suits to swim with seals and hire an unusual mode of transport to take them around the islands.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott hops across to the Italian island of Sardinia, where his first stop is the beachside Ristorante La Spigola for a taste of chef Roberto's modern take on Italian dining. He also gets immersed in a classic Sardinian culinary experience, cooking suckling pig over an open fire, has a masterclass in making the local pasta Jiusoni and learns about another island speciality, casizolu cheese.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Joyce Barnaby swerves off the road into a ditch, convinced she has hit someone, but nobody is found injured and Tom thinks she has imagined it. However, when a local historian discovers the body of a librarian in a nearby cemetery, Joyce blames herself for the man's death, leading her husband into a spooky investigation to find the real killer on the loose in the haunted village of March Magna. Guest starring Danny Webb (The Bill), with John Nettles, Jason Hughes and Jane Wymark.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts another celebrity edition of the game show, which see three of the stars from hit comedy Benidorm - Jake Caruso, Janine Duvitski and Tony Maudsley - answering questions and lining up the drop zones as they try to win as much cash as they can for their chosen charities.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Colin Baker, David Weir, Chelsee Healey and Alex Horne pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle-course challenge, hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara. Members of the public compete alongside celebrities including Jake Quickenden, Dom Lever, Katie Walsh and Lee Latchford-Evans. Those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK.

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show from locations around the UK, setting members of the public unusual challenges for a chance to win anything from the price of their petrol, to 1000 in the big finale game. This week, Stephen is in Bognor Regis.

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the 14th series of the nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win a huge cash prize and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance. Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and David Walliams make up the judging panel, looking for performers worthy of the Golden Buzzer and a slot in the semi-finals.

programme.title: Through the Keyhole
programme.desc: Keith Lemon hosts the third series of the revival of the classic game show originally presented by David Frost. Visiting three mystery celebrity homes each week, he challenges an all-star panel to guess the identities of the famous occupants based on clues highlighted along each tour and the help of the studio audience. In this edition, the Celebrity Juice funnyman is joined by celebrity chef Gino D'Acampo, Coronation Street star Sue Cleaver (Eileen Grimshaw), and comedian and actor Johnny Vegas.

programme.title: The River Wild (1994)
programme.desc: A headstrong white-water rafting expert embarks on a holiday with her family, but their fun comes to an abrupt end when two killers show up. The fugitives' only escape route from the law is down a raging river, so they take the woman and her son hostage to act as guides. Meanwhile, her husband desperately tries to keep track from the riverbank, waiting for his opportunity to launch a rescue attempt. Action thriller, starring Meryl Streep, Kevin Bacon, David Strathairn, Joseph Mazzello and John C Reilly.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Betty wants a nice photo of Dave and Anna, but the camera George uses happens to belong to Gran, and it's been cursed by an ancient mummy..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: If there were two things Dave could wish for it would be for Fuzzypeg to smell better, and for Gran to be nicer. Is getting what you want always a good thing?.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James is joined by friend and Michelin-starred chef Mark Jordan, riding around Jersey on mini motorbikes while exploring the island's culinary delights. James samples one of Jersey's most famous exports - the Jersey Royal potato - which he uses to cook up a squid risotto with a difference. Mark gets a lesson in oyster shucking and James uses Jersey black butter to create a black butter tartlet.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott's tour of Sardinia continues in the Nuoro region, where his guide Claudio takes him to meet his parents, who run a small bakery specialising in pane carasau, a thin crispy bread found all over the island. Claudio then takes the chef to his family's citrus farm to discover local fruit the pompia, a citrus so bitter it is never eaten raw but makes a fabulous liqueur. Moving up to the hills, Ainsley cooks a traditional sheep stew with a group of shepherds, visits one of the island's ancient archaeological sites and cooks up a Sardinian-style minestrone.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner make a chocolate cake out of leftover Easter eggs, and provide recipes for lamb fritters and scrambled eggs. Gino D'Acampo cooks seabass in Sardinia, Levi Roots makes spicy roast lamb, and The Great British Bake Off's Jane Beedle demonstrates cherry and pistachio tart.

programme.title: Griff's Great Australian Adventure
programme.sub-title: Spirit of Queensland: Brisbane to Cairns
programme.desc: Comedian, actor and travel enthusiast Griff Rhys Jones journeys from Brisbane to Cairns aboard the Spirit of Queensland railway - and during his various stops, he comes across all manner of things that seem determined to kill him, from jellyfish to dingoes to whitewater rapids and more.

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent

Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and David Walliams make up the judging panel, looking for performers worthy of the Golden Buzzer and a slot in the semi-finals.

programme.title: Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory (1971)
programme.desc: An eccentric confectionery king announces that five children will be given a tour of his wondrous factory. The winners turn out to be a kind-hearted boy from a penniless family and four obnoxious brats, who face a terrible fate when they misbehave. Musical fantasy, based on Roald Dahl's classic book Charlie and the Chocolate Factory, starring Gene Wilder, Jack Albertson, Peter Ostrum and Roy Kinnear.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard invites Good Morning Britain host Kate Garraway, fashion presenter Gok Wan and former Mrs Brown's Boys star Rory Cowan to take part in the quiz show, answering questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the better their chances of playing for the 20,000 jackpot prize.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Toyah Willcox, John Barnes, Germaine Greer and Audley Harrison pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.sub-title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Singer and presenter Charlotte Church, Pointless co-host Richard Osman and footballer-turned-pundit John Barnes take their turns at answering the 15 questions that could bag them 1million for their chosen charities. As always, if they get stuck, they have four lifelines to fall back on - Ask the Audience, 50/50, Phone a Friend and Ask the Host. Jeremy Clarkson asks the questions.

programme.title: The Good Karma Hospital
programme.desc: Lydia tries to help a mysterious runaway teenager in the chaos of Diwali. Gabriel and Aisha bond over their past when they are thrown together in a clinic. Ted's search reveals new surprises about the mark he left on India and Jyoti discharges herself - but is she ready to go home? Medical drama, starring Amanda Redman, James Krishna Floyd, Priyanka Bose, Kenneth Cranham and Sayani Gupta.

programme.title: Belgravia
programme.desc: A revelation about Charles' past spells disaster for John and jeopardises his entire future. He must act fast to keep the explosive information hidden from those who could use it to ruin his prospects. Anne receives a visit from a former employee, giving Ellis an idea of how to make some money - but she is not as cunning as she thinks. Oliver visits the mill in his search for ammunition to use against Charles, and Lady Templemore stands firm on her plans for Maria's upcoming engagement, meaning the young woman must take matters into her own hands.

programme.title: Secrets of the Driving Test
programme.desc: Cameras capture more would-be drivers as they sit their driving tests. Fifty-six-year-old Julie is desperate to pass on her third attempt, even though she has not driven in more than 24 years, while make-up artist Bradley serenades his driving examiner. In Hull, fiercely competitive father and daughter duo Rich and Yalana have their tests on the same day. Who will triumph? Narrated by Alan Carr.

programme.title: The Trouble with Maggie Cole
programme.desc: As the drama concludes, Roxanna is terrified by Alex's behaviour the previous night, and tries desperately to get to Alex before he confronts the money lenders. Meanwhile, Jill is still feeling shaken after witnessing Peter and Karen kissing and wonders if she should tell Maggie what has happened. As everyone gathers for the village celebrations, a sudden shocking series of events are put in motion that could potentially cost the life of one beloved villager. Starring Dawn French, Mark Heap and Gwyneth Keyworth.

programme.title: St Davids - Britain's Smallest City
programme.desc: Forager Julia scours the shoreline for seaweed for her sustainable soaps, the bug farm hosts its summer fair and the residents of Britain's smallest city celebrate the end of the busy summer season at farmer Gerald's harvest party.

programme.title: Houdini's Last Secrets
programme.desc: In the final episode, experts recreate Houdini's buried alive escape stunt, and investigate if he was killed by more sinister forces.

programme.title: What On Earth?
programme.desc: Documentary looking at the spiral markings spotted by satellite in the remote African desert, and a weird deadly black blob threatening the Florida Keys.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: The team builds a custom bike for the Iraq Star Foundation, and Hollywood stars including Jon Voight, Kristy Swanson and Gary Sinise turn out to support the cause.

programme.title: Airplane Repo
programme.desc: Turbulence could spell disaster for Mike Kennedy, and a second crack at a $3million Citation V offers Ken Cage and Danny Thompson a shot at redemption.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe joins a crew of high-rise window washers and hopes to control his fear while sitting on a small seat 400ft above street level.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: More everyday items are put under the microscope, featuring how three-wheel electric bikes are manufactured and skin cream is made.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: More everyday items are put under the microscope, featuring how Wild West holsters are manufactured and water video housings are made.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien discover items in Wensleydale, North Yorkshire, that are ready for upcycling to turn a profit for their owners.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Phil and Sig's experiment in trading their junior deckhands comes to a close in the third week of hunting king crab.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Rough conditions on the Bering Sea take their toll, and while Shawn makes the most of his excavator skills, one diver realises he does not have enough money to continue dredging.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: On the Road
programme.desc: After a nerve-racking test-drive, Mike Brewer buys a 1981 Series III Land Rover without an MOT for Edd China to restore.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: On the Road
programme.desc: Mike Brewer heads to France to buy a bargain Citroen, but back in the workshop Edd China finds chronic problems with its self-levelling suspension.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini races his 1958 Tojeiro Climax in the Hershey Grand Ascent and the VSCCA Vintage Fall Finale at Lime Rock Park.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini takes a 1941 Lincoln, a 1929 Pierce-Arrow and a Panhard to auction and bids on a Rolls Royce Phantom 3 for a client.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini takes his client's rare 1908 Simplex Speedcar roadster to an auction to see what kind of money it will make.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini restores an AC Ace for a man who has bought it as a surprise for his father.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage Hunters' Drew Pritchard and Turbo Pickers' Paul Cowland embark on an epic motoring mission as the pair scour the UK, buying, restoring and selling classic cars. The duo spot a classic Golf GTI at a film props company and, at a barn in Suffolk, Drew unearths an early 1970s Lotus Elan that needs radical restoration.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Bike guru Henry Cole and his friend Sam Lovegrove, the 'Engine Whisperer', take a trip from Cornwall to Oxfordshire to rummage around in some of Britain's most amazing sheds in search of a nice little earner.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove meet Phil in sunny Buckinghamshire, where they find stationary engines, traction engines and vintage petrol cans - but is there anything for the boys to restore and flog?.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Eccentric military equipment collector Bruce Crompton is tasked with creating a display based on the French Resistance - a parachute basket filled with items the RAF would have dropped to the Resistance during the Second World War.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In Macclesfield, Cheshire, Drew Pritchard meets a mother-and-son team. Later, in Leeds he catches up with a young dealer with an eye for modern pieces.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: The artisan restorers behind Drew Pritchard's antiques empire save an iconic Eames lounge chair. They also revive an unusual 90-year old oil lamp and a glamourous steam trunk.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer tries to track down the first-ever Bond car, a 1963 Sunbeam Alpine. He finds a rust-free, race-ready motor, but Edd China discovers some surprises in the engine bay.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien assess sewing machines in Kent as they continue their journey across the UK to find unique and valuable items 'lost' in people's homes.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard head to a motorbike museum on the Isle of Man, where he hopes its unique history will mean a truckload of rare finds.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Tunnel Rats are under extra pressure as rival miners close in on their claim. Plus, the Bushmen must brave an abandoned mine to remove a dead animal.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Part two of two. Rookie skippers Jake Anderson and Josh Harris struggle as a 600 mile wide arctic storm continues to ravage the fleet.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How a set of jaws are forged, capable of chomping through concrete and demolish tower blocks. Plus, the ways an historic airman's bomber jacket can be stiched, and the means of brewing the oldest beer in the Western world.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How platinum cleans exhaust fumes, and the technology that enabled the construction of a space station 360km above Earth.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a Humvee to work on, and he and Edd China create a four-wheel-drive camping vehicle capable of venturing to places no camper has been before.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Eccentric military equipment collector Bruce Crompton is tasked with creating a display based on the French Resistance - a parachute basket filled with items the RAF would have dropped to the Resistance during the Second World War.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Paul Sr learns Mikey is in rehab and wonders if there is any hope of salvaging their relationship. Meanwhile, the team turns its attention to building a trike for a client.

programme.title: Airplane Repo
programme.desc: Mike Kennedy risks an emergency landing on an Alaskan glacier, while Danny Thompson frees a $1.8million business jet from its hanger - by hand.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe takes on the sticky task of tofu making, and finds out what happens when a TV monitor is destroyed.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The processes of manufacturing wooden garage doors and making animatronic dinosaurs are put under the microscope.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Grammy Awards/Bike Lights/Above-Ground Pools/Foldable Solar Panels
programme.desc: The technology behind the manufacture of Grammy Awards, bike lights, above-ground pools and foldable solar panels.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The complex technological processes involved in cooling the iconic Sydney Opera House. Plus, an insight into how Sheffield steel is transformed into a carpenter's handsaw, and the production of a microphone capable of picking up a whisper.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien assess sewing machines in Kent as they continue their journey across the UK to find unique and valuable items 'lost' in people's homes.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Skippers Sig and Phil try to exchange their deckhands in a high-seas transfer, but the operation does not go smoothly.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Emily struggles to discipline her divers on the Eroica, and Shawn battles a crew that is blocking his way.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: On the Road
programme.desc: Mike Brewer sets out to buy a Rolls-Royce but takes a chance when offered a 1984 Bentley Mulsanne Turbo, much to the dismay of Edd China when he sees the paintwork.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Edd China tries to renovate a Triumph Spitfire sports car so Mike Brewer can sell it for a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China continues to renovate the Triumph Spitfire, replacing the differential and rear shock absorbers and having the bumpers and handles chromed.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: After chasing one for 38 years, Wayne Carini finally acquired a Hudson Italia from a woman called Hazel, who might have more surprises in store for the enthusiast.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini takes his three Ferraris, a 1971 Daytona Coupe and a 1972 Dino GT to the Amelia Island auction.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Vehicle restorer Wayne Carini looks out for a BMW Isetta for his newly married daughter at the Bruce Weiner Microcar Museum sale.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: A 1937 Packard Convertible catches Wayne Carini's eye as he looks around an auction of unusual vehicles.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard spots a 1960s Mini that may be for sale - can he buy it at a good price? Plus, a Cotswold dealer has a Porsche 928, but the budget is hit by some major repairs.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove continue their search through Britain's sheds in search of vintage treasure to restore and sell for a tidy profit. In Surrey, they find Pontiac ambulances, mysterious automotive sculptures and strangely well-preserved motorbikes.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Bike guru Henry Cole and ace mechanic Sam Lovegrove are off to Cornwall. They meet a collector whose cottage is like a transport museum, chock-full with memorabilia, penny farthings and lights of all description - watched over by Buster, the guard rabbit.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Eccentric military equipment collector Bruce Crompton heads to Ypres in Belgium looking for items from the Great War. He tracks down a German trench mortar and also goes for a ride in a First World War-era British tank - one of the first tanks ever used in combat.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard heads to Edinburgh, where he discovers an antique shop with a deluxe 1940s American bike. Later, he finds a mid-century designer desk in Wookey Hole.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard's artisan restorers rescue a ravaged carousel horse dating from before the First World War. Plus, they revive a valuable 1930s sofa and a 100-year-old weathervane.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a Humvee to work on, and he and Edd China create a four-wheel-drive camping vehicle capable of venturing to places no camper has been before.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole tries to restore a monkey bike, and Simon O'Brien makes use of all his skills as he tries to give new life to an old racing bicycle.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard hunts for hidden treasures at a 400-year-old school in Cambridgeshire. Plus, the team takes a tour of one of the oldest paper mills in the United Kingdom.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In Swansea, a huge barge is ripped apart. Meanwhile, in London, six tower blocks are demolished and on the south coast, scrap queens search for valuable scrap material.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team restore a broken hand mirror containing the portrait of a mysterious French lady, and a painting of fog on the river Thames is also repaired.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The requirements that must be met to transform a family car into a rally car. Plus, the manufacture of titanium, the metal that the modern aerospace industry relies on.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.sub-title: Nuclear Sub/Crash Test Dummies/Fruit and Veg
programme.desc: How submarine crews survive being submerged beneath the ocean for months at a time. Plus, how crash test dummies make driving safer.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Edd China try to make a profit on their first electric project as they restore a 1985 Maserati Bi-Turbo that was converted to electric in the early 1990s.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Eccentric military equipment collector Bruce Crompton heads to Ypres in Belgium looking for items from the Great War. He tracks down a German trench mortar and also goes for a ride in a First World War-era British tank - one of the first tanks ever used in combat.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.sub-title: The Jeanette Lee Black Widow Bike
programme.desc: Mikey is ready to make amends after returning from rehab, while the OCC team builds a Black Widow bike for pool champion Jeanette Lee.

programme.title: Airplane Repo
programme.desc: Ken Cage attempts to get a pair of high-end yachts in two days, and Kevin Lacey's favour for a friend turns into a white-knuckle landing in Texas.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe explores a cricket farm in Georgia and discovers how 25 million insects are managed. Later, he heads farther afield to talk about turkey with experts.
